SEARCH
Package com.gcu.apartmentx.controllers

Class UserContoller

java.lang.Object
com.gcu.apartmentx.controllers.UserContoller
@Controller public class UserContoller extends Object
Controller class responsible for handling user-related functionality Provides methods for displaying users, updating user information, and deleting users

  • Method Details

    • deleteUser

      @GetMapping("/users") public String deleteUser(org.springframework.ui.Model m)
      Retrieves all users from the database and displays them in the "Users" view
      Parameters:
      m - the Model object used to pass data to the view
      Returns:
      the "Users" view name

    • updateUser

      @PostMapping("/users/update") public String updateUser(org.springframework.ui.Model m, @RequestParam int id)
      Retrieves a user by their ID and passes the user to the "UpdateUser" view for updating
      Parameters:
      m - the Model object used to pass the user to the view
      id - the ID of the user to be updated
      Returns:
      the "UpdateUser" view name

    • doUpdate

      @PostMapping("/users/update/do-update") public String doUpdate(@RequestParam int id, @RequestParam(required=false) String username, @RequestParam(required=false) String email, @RequestParam(required=false) String password, @RequestParam(required=false) String firstName, @RequestParam(required=false) String lastName, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Handles updating the user's information with the new input values Only updates non-null and non-blank fields
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to be updated
      username - the new username (optional)
      email - the new email (optional)
      password - the new password (optional)
      firstName - the new first name (optional)
      lastName - the new last name (optional)
      redirectAttributes - used for redirection after the update
      Returns:
      redirects to the "/users" page after the update

    • confirmDeleteUser

      @PostMapping("/users/delete") public String confirmDeleteUser(org.springframework.ui.Model m, @RequestParam int id)
      Retrieves a user by their ID and displays the confirmation page for deleting the user
      Parameters:
      m - the Model object used to pass the user to the view
      id - the ID of the user to be deleted
      Returns:
      the "ConfirmDeleteUser" view name

    • doDeleteUser

      @PostMapping("/users/delete/do-delete") public String doDeleteUser(org.springframework.ui.Model m, @RequestParam boolean confirm)
      Handles the deletion of the user if the confirmation is true After deletion, redirects to the "/users" page with the updated list of users
      Parameters:
      m - the Model object used to pass messages to the view
      confirm - whether the deletion is confirmed or not
      Returns:
      redirects to the "/users" page after deletion
